newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks up slightly, hold to narrow ranges.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks up slightly, hold to narrow ranges.

text.p: Wall Street stocks edged up to marginal gains in early afternoon on Friday, but investors appeared unwilling to bid stocks beyond narrow ranges.
The Dow industrials were up 19 points at 7155 and the S&P 500 rose three points to 823.
Techs and small caps also kept to tight bands, with the Nasdaq Composite up two points to 1333 and the Russell 2000 up fractionally at 361.
Afternoon trading lacked any semblance of the choppiness that marked the morning, when blue chips bounced higher only to turn lower and then just as quickly recoup losses.

"It looked like there was some early selling to take profits and then the buying population just disappeared," said Peggy Farley, chief executive at Amas Securities. "There just aren't enough buyers here to keep the market heading up."

Breadth was modestly positive, with advancers running ahead of decliners by about four-to-three on the NYSE. Bonds held to moderate gains, with the 30-year U.S. Treasury up 11/32 to yield 6.91 percent.
